result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek A Pieske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Early discharge from probation granted.
from Agent Dennis Wolf with proposed Order for Early Discharge from Probation - fax
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Derek A Pieske in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed; reading waived. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 2&3 in Amended Complaint without domestic enhancer. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 yr. probation, $443 & $243 costs, Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete anger management or domestic abuse counseling whichever agent deems appropriate. Ct. 1 read in and dismissed. Court granted 2 days jail credit.
